page.title: 07IDSWORTH
page.content:
{ Idsworth House (Old Site) }
There had been a big house at Idsworth for more than a 1000 years.In 1850 the house was pulled down and rebuilt two miles away because the railway was to be built through its garden. The house then belonged to Sir Jervoise Clarke_Jervoise. The main house was pulled down. There remains the coach house which is now a private house,the pigeon house,the ice house,the well house which had a well 300 feet deep,and the water was pumped up by means of a horse,the game house,which is a large underground room,and a walled garden.
